claim: If Michael Schumacher had pitted one lap earlier at the 2006 San Marino Grand Prix, he would have lost the lead to Fernando Alonso.
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It speculates about what would have happened if Michael Schumacher had pitted one lap earlier ('If X had happened... he would have...'). The database only records what actually occurred, not what would have happened under hypothetical pit stop strategies. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data.

content.text:
This claim describes a hypothetical "what if" scenario: "If Michael Schumacher had pitted one lap earlier... he would have lost the lead." This is a counterfactual claim — it speculates about what would have happened under different circumstances.

According to my instructions, counterfactual claims that describe hypothetical scenarios ("If X had happened...", "Would have...") CANNOT be verified from a database that only records what actually happened. They must always be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "This is a counterfactual claim. It speculates about what would have happened if Michael Schumacher had pitted one lap earlier ('If X had happened... he would have...'). The database only records what actually occurred, not what would have happened under hypothetical pit stop strategies. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data."}
```
